provenance.note: Ozias Humphry; likely passed to his son William Upcott; acquired by J. R. Smith no later than 1828; ownership unknown after 1829 until offered for sale by Thomas Thorp in 1837 for 15s; later in the collection of Major C. H. Simpson of Bath; sold at Sotheby's, 15 March 1916, lot 33 to G. D. Smith for £51; acquired by Oliver R. Barrett; passed to his son Roger W. Barrett; sold at Sotheby's New York, 14 December 1988, lot 58 for $24,000; sold by John Wilson Autographs Ltd at Sotheby's London 14 December 1992, lot 16 for £18,000; in the Roy Davids Collection; sold at Bonham's 18 March 2015 for £43,750 to dealer Benjamin Spademan.

desc.objtitle: The Design of The Last Judgment Letter to Ozias Humphrey, Object 1

lg.l: To Ozias Humphry Esq:reEsquire
The Design of The Last Judgment, which I have
completed by your recommendation for The Countess of Egremont.
it is necessary to give some account of: & its various parts
ought to be described, for the accomodation of those who give it
the honorhonour of attention.
Christ seated on the Throne of Judgment:
The Heavens in Clouds rolling before him & around him, like
a Scroll ready to be consumed in the fires of the Angels; whoKeynes (*Letters*, page 132) reads "scroll" for "Scroll".
descend before his feet with their four trumpets sounding to the
four Winds.
Beneath; the Earth is convulsedconvuls'd with the labourslabors
of the Resurrection; In the caverns of the Earth is the Dragon
with seven heads & ten horns, Chained by two Angels & above
his Cavern on the Earths Surface, is the Harlot also siezedKeynes (*Letters*, page 132) reads "surface" for "Surface".
& bound by two Angels with Chains while her Palaces are falling
into ruins & her Counselor'sCounsellors & Warriors are descending into the
Abyss in wailings & despair
Hell opens beneath the Harlots seat on the left hand
into which the Wicked are descending

desc.objtitle: cont. Letter to Ozias Humphry, 18 January 1808, Object 2

lg.l: The right hand of the Design is appropriated to the Re-Resurrection
-surrectionResurrection of The Just; the left hand of the Design is appro-appropriated
-priatedappropriated to the Resurrection & Fall of the Wicked
Immediately before the Throne of Christ is Adam &
Eve, kneeling in humiliation, as representitives of the whole Human
Race; Abraham & Moses kneel on each side beneath them; from
the Cloud on which Eve kneels & beneath Moses & from the Tables
of Stone which utter lightnings; is seen Satan wound round
by the Serpent & falling headlong; the Pharisees appear on
the left hand pleading their own righteousness before the Throne
of Christ: The Book of Death is opendopened on Clouds by two Angels;
many groupes of Figures are falling from before the Throne &
from the Sea of Fire which flows before the Steps of the Throne;Keynes (*Letters*, page 132) reads "steps" for "Steps".
on which are seen the Seven Lamps of the Almighty. burning
before the Throne. many Figures Chaindchained & bound together fall thro'through
the air, & some are scourged by Spirits with flames of fire into the
Abyss of Hell which opens to recieve them beneath, on the left hand
of the Harlot's seat; where others are howling & descending into the
flames. & in the act of dragging each other into Hell & of con-contending
tendingcontending in fighting with each other on the brink of Perdition
Before the Throne of Christ on the right hand
the Just in humiliation & in exultation, rise thro'through the air,

desc.objtitle: cont. Letter to Ozias Humphry, 18 January 1808, Object 3

lg.l: with their Children & Families; some of whom are bowing before
the Book of Life which is opendopened by two Angels on Clouds; many
GroupesGroups arise with Exultation; among them ins a Figure crowned
with Stars & the moon beneath her feet with six infants around her
She represents the Christian Church; The Green Hills appear
beneath: with the Graves of the Blessed, which are seen bursting
with their births of immortality; Parents & Children embrace
& arise together & in exulting attitudes tell each other, that The
New Jerusalem is ready to descend upon Earth; they arise upon
the air rejoicing! others newly awakendawakened from the Grave stand
upon the Earth embracing & shouting to the Lamb who cometh
in the Clouds with Power & great Glory.
The whole upper part of the Design is a view of Heaven
opened; around the Throne of Christ, Four Living Creatures filled
with Eyes, attended by seven Angles with the Seven Vials of the
Wrath of God, & above these Seven Angles with the Seven Trumpets
compose the Cloud, which by its rolling away displays the opening
Seats of the Blessed, on the right & the left of which are seen the
Four & Twenty Elders seated on Thrones to Judge the Dead.
Behind the Seat and Throne of Christ appears the Tabernacle
with its Veil opened; the Candlestick on the right; the Table with
Shew BreadShowbreadShewbread, on the left; & in the midst, the Cross in place of
the Ark, with the two Cherubim bowing over it.

desc.objtitle: cont. Letter to Ozias Humphry, 18 January 1808, Object 4

lg.l: On the right hand of the Throne of Christ is Baptism.
On his left is the LordsLord's Supper; the two introducers into
Eternal Life. Women with Infants approach the Figure of
an aged apostle which represents Baptism; & on the left hand
the Lords Supper is administerdadministered by Angels, from the hands of
another aged Apostle; these kneel on each side of the ThroneKeynes (*Letters*, page 133) reads "Kneel" for "kneel".
which is surrounded by a glory, in the glory many Infants
appear, representing Eternal Creation flowing from The
Divine Humanity in Jesus; who opens the Scroll of Judgment
upon his knees before the Living & the Dead.
Such is the Design which you my Dear Sir
have been the cause of my producing & which; but
for you might have slept till the Last Judgment.
William Blake
18 January 1808.
